alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 11 at 2:19PM MDT until October 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory until 7 pm MDT this evening, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the Freeze Watch Thursday evening through Friday morning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 25 possible. * WHERE...Paradox Valley/Lower Dolores River, Four Corners/Upper Dolores River and Animas River Basin. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM MDT this evening. For the Freeze Watch, from Thursday evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. People, especially those with respiratory illnesses, heart disease, the elderly, and children are recommended to stay indoors and avoid prolonged outdoor exercise or heavy exertion due to wind-blown dust. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Animas River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River
